name: Sierra Leone
description: Sierra Leone, officially the Republic of Sierra Leone, is a country located on the West African coast. Known for its diverse landscapes, rich culture, and complex history, it boasts stunning beaches, lush rainforests, and significant wildlife. The country is a former British colony and has experienced periods of civil conflict, but is now focused on sustainable development and tourism.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city and largest urban center.
quickFacts.detail: Freetown is a port city with a unique history, largely shaped by its founding as a settlement for freed slaves from Britain.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Sierra Leone's population is predominantly young.
quickFacts.detail: The median age is approximately 18.5 years, presenting both challenges and opportunities for the nation's future.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A relatively small West African nation.
quickFacts.detail: It's the second-smallest country in Africa.

quickFacts.label: Official Languages
quickFacts.description: English is the official language, while Mende is widely spoken.
quickFacts.detail: Numerous other indigenous languages are also spoken throughout the country.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Sierra Leone's economy is largely based on agriculture and mining.
quickFacts.detail: The country is working to diversify its economy and reduce its reliance on these sectors.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The exchange rate fluctuates, but is approximately 1 USD = 63 SLL (as of Oct 26, 2023).

climateData.title: Climate of Sierra Leone
climateData.description: Sierra Leone experiences a tropical savanna climate, characterized by high temperatures and rainfall throughout the year. There are distinct wet and dry seasons.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season brings cooler temperatures and significantly reduced rainfall.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season is marked by heavy rainfall and high humidity.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Harmattan Winds
seasonalCharacteristics.description: A dry, dusty wind originating from the Sahara Desert.

naturalWonders.name: Stone Town, Freetown
naturalWonders.description: Stone Town is the historic heart of Freetown, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It’s a labyrinth of narrow streets, colonial-era buildings, and vibrant markets, offering a glimpse into the city’s complex past.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Founded as a settlement for freed slaves in 1787, Stone Town retains its unique architectural style and cultural heritage.  The area is filled with bustling markets, craft shops, and traditional restaurants.

naturalWonders.name: Ti Tree Hills National Park
naturalWonders.description: A rugged mountain range offering stunning views and diverse wildlife, including chimpanzees and various bird species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Ti Tree Hills are a relatively unexplored area of Sierra Leone, characterized by steep slopes, dense forests, and unique flora and fauna.  The area is known for its challenging hiking trails and remote beauty.

naturalWonders.name: Bunce Island
naturalWonders.description: A poignant reminder of the transatlantic slave trade, Bunce Island is a fortified island that served as a major hub for the capture and sale of enslaved Africans.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Bunce Island, located off the coast of Sierra Leone, was a significant center for the slave trade during the 18th century.  The ruins of the fort and the stories of those who were enslaved there offer a sobering look at a dark chapter in human history.
bestLocations: Boat trip from Sierra Leone Island
viewingTips: Take a guided tour to learn about the island's history
Reflect on the impact of the slave trade

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Sierra Leone
ecosystemData.overview: Sierra Leone’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from coastal mangroves to rainforests and savanna grasslands. These ecosystems support a rich array of plant and animal life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Dominating the landscape, Sierra Leone’s forests are home to a vast array of plant and animal species.

statistics.details: A significant portion are endemic to Sierra Leone.
Ranked among the most biodiverse countries in Africa.

notableSpecies.name: Red Colobus Monkey
notableSpecies.significance: A flagship species for conservation efforts.

notableSpecies.name: African Grey Parrot
notableSpecies.significance: Known for its intelligence and vocalizations.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mangroves
biodiversityCategories.description: Coastal mangrove forests provide critical habitat for numerous species and protect the coastline from erosion.

notableSpecies.name: Mudskipper
notableSpecies.significance: An indicator species for mangrove health.

activities.title: Activities in Sierra Leone
activities.description: Sierra Leone offers a wide range of activities for travelers, from wildlife viewing and hiking to water sports and cultural experiences.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the country’s mountainous regions and rainforests.

activities.name: Ti Tree Hills Trek
activities.description: A challenging trek through the Ti Tree Hills, offering stunning views and wildlife encounters.
activities.requirements: Hiking boots, water bottle, sunscreen, insect repellent

activities.name: Mount Loma Hike
activities.description: A relatively easy hike to the summit of Mount Loma, offering panoramic views of Freetown.
safety: Be aware of the weather conditions

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the country’s beautiful coastline with a variety of water sports.

activities.name: Surfing
activities.description: Several beaches offer good surfing conditions.
safety: Check surf conditions before entering the water

activities.name: Fishing
activities.description: Traditional fishing is a significant part of the local culture.

clothing.winter: Layers of clothing, waterproof jacket, warm sweater
